translation.text: their minds are turned towards the Lord in the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev

Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਤ੍ਰੈ ਗੁਨ ਮਾਈ ਮੋਹਿ ਆਈ ਕਹੰਉ ਬੇਦਨ ਕਾਹਿ ॥੧॥

translation.text: Maya with her three gunas - the three dispositions - has come to entice me; whom can I tell of my pain? ||1||

transliteration.text: trai gun māī mōh āī kahanu bēdan kāh .1.

text: ਆਨ ਉਪਾਵ ਸਗਰ ਕੀਏ ਨਹਿ ਦੂਖ ਸਾਕਹਿ ਲਾਹਿ ॥

translation.text: I tried everything else, but nothing could rid me of my sorrow.

transliteration.text: ān upāv sagar kīē nah dūkh sākah lāh .

text: ਭਜੁ ਸਰਨਿ ਸਾਧੂ ਨਾਨਕਾ ਮਿਲੁ ਗੁਨ ਗੋਬਿੰਦਹਿ ਗਾਹਿ ॥੨॥੨॥੨੪॥

translation.text: So hurry to the Sanctuary of the Holy, O Nanak; joining them, sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord of the Universe. ||2||2||24||

transliteration.text: bhaj saran sādhū nānakā mil gun gōbindah gāh .2.2.24.

text: ਹਾਹਾ ਹੂਹੂ ਗੰਧ੍ਰਬ ਅਪਸਰਾ ਅਨੰਦ ਮੰਗਲ ਰਸ ਗਾਵਨੀ ਨੀਕੀ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: The celestial singers and angels sing His Sublime Praises in ecstasy, happiness and joy. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: hāhā hūhū gandhrab apasarā anand mangal ras gāvanī nīkī .1. rahāu .

text: ਧੁਨਿਤ ਲਲਿਤ ਗੁਨਗ੍ਯ ਅਨਿਕ ਭਾਂਤਿ ਬਹੁ ਬਿਧਿ ਰੂਪ ਦਿਖਾਵਨੀ ਨੀਕੀ ॥੧॥

translation.text: The most worthy beings sing God's Praises in beautiful harmonies, in all sorts of ways, in myriads of sublime forms. ||1||

transliteration.text: dhunit lalit gunagy anik bhānht bah bidh rūp dikhāvanī nīkī .1.

text: ਗਿਰਿ ਤਰ ਥਲ ਜਲ ਭਵਨ ਭਰਪੁਰਿ ਘਟਿ ਘਟਿ ਲਾਲਨ ਛਾਵਨੀ ਨੀਕੀ ॥

translation.text: Throughout the mountains, trees, deserts, oceans and galaxies, permeating each and every heart, the sublime grandeur of my Love is totally pervading.

transliteration.text: gir tar thal jal bhavan bharapur ghat ghat lālan shāvanī nīkī .

author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: The rainbird's mind is drawn to the rain-drop

melody.description: Malhar is a communication of feelings from the soul, to show the mind how to become cool and refreshed. The mind is always burning with the desire to reach its goals quickly and without effort, however the emotions conveyed in this Raag are able to bring composure and fulfilment to the mind. It is able to bring the mind into this calmness, bringing a sense of satisfaction and contentment.

text: ਛੋਡਿ ਮਾਨੁ ਤਜਿ ਗੁਮਾਨੁ ਮਿਲਿ ਸਾਧੂਆ ਕੈ ਸੰਗਿ ॥

translation.text: Forsake your pride, and abandon your ego; join the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy.

transliteration.text: shōd mān taj gumān mil sādhūā kai sang .

melody.description: Malhar is a communication of feelings from the soul, to show the mind how to become cool and refreshed. text: ਹਰਿ ਸਿਮਰਿ ਏਕ ਰੰਗਿ ਮਿਟਿ ਜਾਂਹਿ ਦੋਖ ਮੀਤ ॥੧॥

translation.text: Meditate in loving remembrance on the One Lord; your sorrows shall be ended, O friend. ||1||

transliteration.text: har simar ēk rang mit jānhh dōkh mīt .1.

text: ਹਰਿ ਚਰਨ ਸਰਨ ਤਰਨ ਸਾਗਰ ਧੁਨਿ ਅਨਹਤਾ ਰਸ ਬੈਨ ॥੧॥

translation.text: The Sanctuary of the Lord's Feet carries us across the world-ocean. His Sublime Word is the unstruck celestial melody. ||1||

transliteration.text: har charan saran taran sāgar dhun anahatā ras bain .1.

melody.description: Malhar is a communication of feelings from the soul, to show the mind how to become cool and refreshed. The mind is always burning with the desire to reach its goals quickly and without effort, however the emotions conveyed in this Raag are able to bring composure and fulfilment to the mind. It is able to bring the mind into this calmness, bringing a sense of satisfaction and contentment.

text: ਪਥਿਕ ਪਿਆਸ ਚਿਤ ਸਰੋਵਰ ਆਤਮ ਜਲੁ ਲੈਨ ॥

translation.text: The thirsty traveller's consciousness obtains the water of the soul from the pool of nectar.

transliteration.text: pathik piās chit sarōvar ātam jal lain .

melody.description: Malhar is a communication of feelings from the soul, to show the mind how to become cool and refreshed. text: ਹਰਿ ਦਰਸ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਜਨ ਨਾਨਕ ਕਰਿ ਕਿਰਪਾ ਪ੍ਰਭ ਦੈਨ ॥੨॥੭॥੨੯॥

translation.text: Servant Nanak loves the Blessed Vision of the Lord; in His Mercy, God has blessed him with it. ||2||7||29||

transliteration.text: har daras prēm jan nānak kar kirapā prabh dain .2.7.29.

melody.description: Malhar is a communication of feelings from the soul, to show the mind how to become cool and refreshed. The mind is always burning with the desire to reach its goals quickly and without effort, however the emotions conveyed in this Raag are able to bring composure and fulfilment to the mind. It is able to bring the mind into this calmness, bringing a sense of satisfaction and contentment.
